snippet: Cutting the force by more than half, while still leaving commanders with flexibility until after the next fighting season.
abstract: Pres Obama's decision to remove 34,000 American troops in Afghanistan over the next year represents careful balancing of political interests and military requirements; draw-down will represent more than half of the American military presence in Afghanistan.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Cutting the force by more than half, while still leaving commanders with flexibility until after the next fighting season.

headline.main: Decision on Afghan Troop Levels Calculates Political and Military Interests
headline.print_headline: Decision on Afghan Troop Levels Calculates Political and Military Interests

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
